verses.verse: And he heard <S%H8085><s%> the words <S%H1697><s%> of Laban's <S%H3837><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Jacob <S%H3290><s%> hath taken away <S%H3947><s%> all that was our father's <S%H1><s%>; and of that which was our father's <S%H1><s%> hath he gotten <S%H6213><s%> all this glory <S%H3519><s%>.
And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> beheld <S%H7200><s%> the countenance <S%H6440><s%> of Laban <S%H3837><s%>, and, behold, it was not toward him as <S%H8543><s%> before <S%H8032><s%>.

And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto Jacob <S%H3290><s%>, Return <S%H7725><s%> unto the land <S%H776><s%> of thy fathers <S%H1><s%>, and to thy kindred <S%H4138><s%>; and I will be with thee.
And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> and called <S%H7121><s%> Rachel <S%H7354><s%> and Leah <S%H3812><s%> to the field <S%H7704><s%> unto his flock <S%H6629><s%>,

And said <S%H559><s%> unto them, I see <S%H7200><s%> your father's <S%H1><s%> countenance <S%H6440><s%>, that it is not toward me as <S%H8543><s%> before <S%H8032><s%>; but the God <S%H430><s%> of my father <S%H1><s%> hath been <S%H1961><s%> with me.
And ye <S%H859><s%> know <S%H3045><s%> that with all my power <S%H3581><s%> I have served <S%H5647><s%> your father <S%H1><s%>.

And your father <S%H1><s%> hath deceived <S%H2048><s%> me, and changed <S%H2498><s%> my wages <S%H4909><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> times <S%H4489><s%>; but God <S%H430><s%> suffered him <S%H5414><s%> not to hurt <S%H7489><s%> me <S%H5978><s%>.

If he said <S%H559><s%> thus, The speckled <S%H5348><s%> shall be thy wages <S%H7939><s%>; then all the cattle <S%H6629><s%> bare <S%H3205><s%> speckled <S%H5348><s%>: and if he said <S%H559><s%> thus, The ringstraked <S%H6124><s%> shall be thy hire <S%H7939><s%>; then bare <S%H3205><s%> all the cattle <S%H6629><s%> ringstraked <S%H6124><s%>.
Thus God <S%H430><s%> hath taken away <S%H5337><s%> the cattle <S%H4735><s%> of your father <S%H1><s%>, and given <S%H5414><s%> them to me.

And it came to pass at the time <S%H6256><s%> that the cattle <S%H6629><s%> conceived <S%H3179><s%>, that I lifted up <S%H5375><s%> mine eyes <S%H5869><s%>, and saw <S%H7200><s%> in a dream <S%H2472><s%>, and, behold, the rams <S%H6260><s%> which leaped <S%H5927><s%> upon the cattle <S%H6629><s%> were ringstraked <S%H6124><s%>, speckled <S%H5348><s%>, and grisled <S%H1261><s%>.
And the angel <S%H4397><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> spake <S%H559><s%> unto me in a dream <S%H2472><s%>, saying, Jacob <S%H3290><s%>: And I said <S%H559><s%>, Here am I.

And he said <S%H559><s%>, Lift up <S%H5375><s%> now thine eyes <S%H5869><s%>, and see <S%H7200><s%>, all the rams <S%H6260><s%> which leap <S%H5927><s%> upon the cattle <S%H6629><s%> are ringstraked <S%H6124><s%>, speckled <S%H5348><s%>, and grisled <S%H1261><s%>: for I have seen <S%H7200><s%> all that Laban <S%H3837><s%> doeth <S%H6213><s%> unto thee.

I am the God <S%H410><s%> of Beth-el <S%H1008><s%>, where thou anointedst <S%H4886><s%> the pillar <S%H4676><s%>, and where thou vowedst <S%H5087><s%> a vow <S%H5088><s%> unto me: now arise <S%H6965><s%>, get thee out <S%H3318><s%> from this land <S%H776><s%>, and return <S%H7725><s%> unto the land <S%H776><s%> of thy kindred <S%H4138><s%>.

And Rachel <S%H7354><s%> and Leah <S%H3812><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> unto him, Is there yet any portion <S%H2506><s%> or inheritance <S%H5159><s%> for us in our father's <S%H1><s%> house <S%H1004><s%>?
Are we not counted <S%H2803><s%> of him strangers <S%H5237><s%>? for he hath sold <S%H4376><s%> us, and hath quite <S%H398><s%> devoured <S%H398><s%> also our money <S%H3701><s%>.

For all the riches <S%H6239><s%> which God <S%H430><s%> hath taken <S%H5337><s%> from our father <S%H1><s%>, that is ours, and our children's <S%H1121><s%>: now then, whatsoever God <S%H430><s%> hath said <S%H559><s%> unto thee, do <S%H6213><s%>.
¶ Then Jacob <S%H3290><s%> rose up <S%H6965><s%>, and set <S%H5375><s%> his sons <S%H1121><s%> and his wives <S%H802><s%> upon camels <S%H1581><s%>;

And he carried away <S%H5090><s%> all his cattle <S%H4735><s%>, and all his goods <S%H7399><s%> which he had gotten <S%H7408><s%>, the cattle <S%H4735><s%> of his getting <S%H7075><s%>, which he had gotten <S%H7408><s%> in Padan-aram <S%H6307><s%>, for to go <S%H935><s%> to Isaac <S%H3327><s%> his father <S%H1><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Canaan <S%H3667><s%>.

And Laban <S%H3837><s%> went <S%H1980><s%> to shear <S%H1494><s%> his sheep <S%H6629><s%>: and Rachel <S%H7354><s%> had stolen <S%H1589><s%> the images <S%H8655><s%> that were her father's <S%H1><s%>.

And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> stole away <S%H1589><s%> unawares <S%H3820><s%> to Laban <S%H3837><s%> the Syrian <S%H761><s%>, in that <S%H5921><s%> he told <S%H5046><s%> him not <S%H1097><s%> that he fled <S%H1272><s%>.

So he fled <S%H1272><s%> with all that he had; and he rose up <S%H6965><s%>, and passed over <S%H5674><s%> the river <S%H5104><s%>, and set <S%H7760><s%> his face <S%H6440><s%> toward the mount <S%H2022><s%> Gilead <S%H1568><s%>.
And it was told <S%H5046><s%> Laban <S%H3837><s%> on the third <S%H7992><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> that Jacob <S%H3290><s%> was fled <S%H1272><s%>.

And he took <S%H3947><s%> his brethren <S%H251><s%> with him, and pursued <S%H7291><s%> after him <S%H310><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> days' <S%H3117><s%> journey <S%H1870><s%>; and they overtook <S%H1692><s%> him in the mount <S%H2022><s%> Gilead <S%H1568><s%>.

And God <S%H430><s%> came <S%H935><s%> to Laban <S%H3837><s%> the Syrian <S%H761><s%> in a dream <S%H2472><s%> by night <S%H3915><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> unto him, Take heed <S%H8104><s%> that thou speak <S%H1696><s%> not to <S%H5973><s%> Jacob <S%H3290><s%> either good <S%H2896><s%> or <S%H5704><s%> bad <S%H7451><s%>.

¶ Then Laban <S%H3837><s%> overtook <S%H5381><s%> Jacob <S%H3290><s%>. Now Jacob <S%H3290><s%> had pitched <S%H8628><s%> his tent <S%H168><s%> in the mount <S%H2022><s%>: and Laban <S%H3837><s%> with his brethren <S%H251><s%> pitched <S%H8628><s%> in the mount <S%H2022><s%> of Gilead <S%H1568><s%>.

And Laban <S%H3837><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Jacob <S%H3290><s%>, What hast thou done <S%H6213><s%>, that thou hast stolen away <S%H1589><s%> unawares <S%H3824><s%> to me, and carried away <S%H5090><s%> my daughters <S%H1323><s%>, as captives <S%H7617><s%> taken with the sword <S%H2719><s%>?

Wherefore didst thou flee away <S%H1272><s%> secretly <S%H2244><s%>, and steal away <S%H1589><s%> from me; and didst not tell <S%H5046><s%> me, that I might have sent thee away <S%H7971><s%> with mirth <S%H8057><s%>, and with songs <S%H7892><s%>, with tabret <S%H8596><s%>, and with harp <S%H3658><s%>?
And hast not suffered <S%H5203><s%> me to kiss <S%H5401><s%> my sons <S%H1121><s%> and my daughters <S%H1323><s%>? thou hast now done foolishly <S%H5528><s%> in so doing <S%H6213><s%>.

It is <S%H3426><s%> in the power <S%H410><s%> of my hand <S%H3027><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%> you hurt <S%H7451><s%>: but the God <S%H430><s%> of your father <S%H1><s%> spake <S%H559><s%> unto me yesternight <S%H570><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Take thou heed <S%H8104><s%> that thou speak not <S%H1696><s%> to Jacob <S%H3290><s%> either good <S%H2896><s%> or bad <S%H7451><s%>.

And now, though thou wouldest needs <S%H1980><s%> be gone <S%H1980><s%>, because thou sore <S%H3700><s%> longedst <S%H3700><s%> after thy father's <S%H1><s%> house <S%H1004><s%>, yet wherefore hast thou stolen <S%H1589><s%> my gods <S%H430><s%>?

And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> to Laban <S%H3837><s%>, Because I was afraid <S%H3372><s%>: for I said <S%H559><s%>, Peradventure <S%H6435><s%> thou wouldest take by force <S%H1497><s%> thy daughters <S%H1323><s%> from me.

With whomsoever <S%H834><s%> thou findest <S%H4672><s%> thy gods <S%H430><s%>, let him not live <S%H2421><s%>: before <S%H5048><s%> our brethren <S%H251><s%> discern <S%H5234><s%> thou what is thine with me, and take <S%H3947><s%> it to thee. For Jacob <S%H3290><s%> knew <S%H3045><s%> not that Rachel <S%H7354><s%> had stolen <S%H1589><s%> them.

And Laban <S%H3837><s%> went <S%H935><s%> into Jacob's <S%H3290><s%> tent <S%H168><s%>, and into Leah's <S%H3812><s%> tent <S%H168><s%>, and into the two <S%H8147><s%> maidservants' <S%H519><s%> tents <S%H168><s%>; but he found <S%H4672><s%> them not. Then went he out <S%H3318><s%> of Leah's <S%H3812><s%> tent <S%H168><s%>, and entered <S%H935><s%> into Rachel's <S%H7354><s%> tent <S%H168><s%>.

Now Rachel <S%H7354><s%> had taken <S%H3947><s%> the images <S%H8655><s%>, and put <S%H7760><s%> them in the camel's <S%H1581><s%> furniture <S%H3733><s%>, and sat <S%H3427><s%> upon them. And Laban <S%H3837><s%> searched <S%H4959><s%> all the tent <S%H168><s%>, but found <S%H4672><s%> them not.

And she said <S%H559><s%> to her father <S%H1><s%>, Let it not displease <S%H2734><s%> <S%H5869><s%> my lord <S%H113><s%> that I cannot <S%H3201><s%> rise up <S%H6965><s%> before thee <S%H6440><s%>; for the custom <S%H1870><s%> of women <S%H802><s%> is upon me. And he searched <S%H2664><s%>, but found <S%H4672><s%> not the images <S%H8655><s%>.

¶ And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> was wroth <S%H2734><s%>, and chode <S%H7378><s%> with Laban <S%H3837><s%>: and Jacob <S%H3290><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> to Laban <S%H3837><s%>, What is my trespass <S%H6588><s%>? what is my sin <S%H2403><s%>, that thou hast so hotly pursued <S%H1814><s%> after me <S%H310><s%>?

Whereas <S%H3588><s%> thou hast searched <S%H4959><s%> all my stuff <S%H3627><s%>, what hast thou found <S%H4672><s%> of all thy household <S%H1004><s%> stuff <S%H3627><s%>? set <S%H7760><s%> it here <S%H3541><s%> before my brethren <S%H251><s%> and thy brethren <S%H251><s%>, that they may judge <S%H3198><s%> betwixt <S%H996><s%> us both <S%H8147><s%>.

This twenty <S%H6242><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> have I been with thee; thy ewes <S%H7353><s%> and thy she goats <S%H5795><s%> have not cast their young <S%H7921><s%>, and the rams <S%H352><s%> of thy flock <S%H6629><s%> have I not eaten <S%H398><s%>.

That which was torn <S%H2966><s%> of beasts I brought <S%H935><s%> not unto thee; I bare the loss <S%H2398><s%> of it; of my hand <S%H3027><s%> didst thou require <S%H1245><s%> it, whether stolen <S%H1589><s%> by day <S%H3117><s%>, or stolen <S%H1589><s%> by night <S%H3915><s%>.

Thus I was; in the day <S%H3117><s%> the drought <S%H2721><s%> consumed <S%H398><s%> me, and the frost <S%H7140><s%> by night <S%H3915><s%>; and my sleep <S%H8142><s%> departed <S%H5074><s%> from mine eyes <S%H5869><s%>.

Thus have I been twenty <S%H6242><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> in thy house <S%H1004><s%>; I served thee <S%H5647><s%> fourteen <S%H702><s%> <S%H6240><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> for thy two <S%H8147><s%> daughters <S%H1323><s%>, and six <S%H8337><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> for thy cattle <S%H6629><s%>: and thou hast changed <S%H2498><s%> my wages <S%H4909><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> times <S%H4489><s%>.

Except <S%H3884><s%> the God <S%H430><s%> of my father <S%H1><s%>, the God <S%H430><s%> of Abraham <S%H85><s%>, and the fear <S%H6343><s%> of Isaac <S%H3327><s%>, had been with me, surely thou hadst sent me away <S%H7971><s%> now empty <S%H7387><s%>. God <S%H430><s%> hath seen <S%H7200><s%> mine affliction <S%H6040><s%> and the labour <S%H3018><s%> of my hands <S%H3709><s%>, and rebuked <S%H3198><s%> thee yesternight <S%H570><s%>.

¶ And Laban <S%H3837><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> unto Jacob <S%H3290><s%>, These daughters <S%H1323><s%> are my daughters <S%H1323><s%>, and these children <S%H1121><s%> are my children <S%H1121><s%>, and these cattle <S%H6629><s%> are my cattle <S%H6629><s%>, and all that thou seest <S%H7200><s%> is mine: and what can I do <S%H6213><s%> this day <S%H3117><s%> unto these my daughters <S%H1323><s%>, or <S%H176><s%> unto their children <S%H1121><s%> which they have born <S%H3205><s%>?
Now therefore come thou <S%H3212><s%>, let us make <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%>, I and thou; and let it be for a witness <S%H5707><s%> between me and thee.
And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> a stone <S%H68><s%>, and set it up <S%H7311><s%> for a pillar <S%H4676><s%>.

And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto his brethren <S%H251><s%>, Gather <S%H3950><s%> stones <S%H68><s%>; and they took <S%H3947><s%> stones <S%H68><s%>, and made <S%H6213><s%> an heap <S%H1530><s%>: and they did eat <S%H398><s%> there upon the heap <S%H1530><s%>.
And Laban <S%H3837><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> it Jegar-sahadutha <S%H3026><s%>: but Jacob <S%H3290><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> it Galeed <S%H1567><s%>.

And Laban <S%H3837><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, This heap <S%H1530><s%> is a witness <S%H5707><s%> between me and thee this day <S%H3117><s%>. Therefore was the name <S%H8034><s%> of it called <S%H7121><s%> Galeed <S%H1567><s%>;

And Mizpah <S%H4709><s%>; for <S%H834><s%> he said <S%H559><s%>, The LORD <S%H3068><s%> watch <S%H6822><s%> between me and thee, when we are absent <S%H5641><s%> one <S%H376><s%> from another <S%H7453><s%>.

If thou shalt afflict <S%H6031><s%> my daughters <S%H1323><s%>, or if thou shalt take <S%H3947><s%> other wives <S%H802><s%> beside <S%H5921><s%> my daughters <S%H1323><s%>, no man <S%H376><s%> is with us; see <S%H7200><s%>, God <S%H430><s%> is witness <S%H5707><s%> betwixt me and thee.
And Laban <S%H3837><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Jacob <S%H3290><s%>, Behold this heap <S%H1530><s%>, and behold this pillar <S%H4676><s%>, which I have cast <S%H3384><s%> betwixt me and thee;

This heap <S%H1530><s%> be witness <S%H5707><s%>, and this pillar <S%H4676><s%> be witness <S%H5713><s%>, that I will not pass over <S%H5674><s%> this heap <S%H1530><s%> to thee, and that thou shalt not pass over <S%H5674><s%> this heap <S%H1530><s%> and this pillar <S%H4676><s%> unto me, for harm <S%H7451><s%>.

The God <S%H430><s%> of Abraham <S%H85><s%>, and the God <S%H430><s%> of Nahor <S%H5152><s%>, the God <S%H430><s%> of their father <S%H1><s%>, judge <S%H8199><s%> betwixt us. And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> sware <S%H7650><s%> by the fear <S%H6343><s%> of his father <S%H1><s%> Isaac <S%H3327><s%>.

Then Jacob <S%H3290><s%> offered <S%H2076><s%> sacrifice <S%H2077><s%> upon the mount <S%H2022><s%>, and called <S%H7121><s%> his brethren <S%H251><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%>: and they did eat <S%H398><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%>, and tarried all night <S%H3885><s%> in the mount <S%H2022><s%>.

And early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%> Laban <S%H3837><s%> rose up <S%H7925><s%>, and kissed <S%H5401><s%> his sons <S%H1121><s%> and his daughters <S%H1323><s%>, and blessed <S%H1288><s%> them: and Laban <S%H3837><s%> departed <S%H3212><s%>, and returned <S%H7725><s%> unto his place <S%H4725><s%>.
